entry.title: Riemann Curvature Tensor
entry.content:
超脱 (Detachment)

Derivative Operator

Definition 1.1 Let \(\mathscr{F}_{M}(k,l)\) be the set of all \(\mathrm{C}^{\infty}\) tensor field of \((k,l)\) type. The map \( abla\) : \(\mathscr{F}_{M}(k,l) ightarrow\mathscr{F}_{M}(k,l+1)\) is called the derivative operator on the manifold \(M\) if it satisfies the following conditions:

  1. Linearity: For all \(A\), \(B\in\mathscr{F}_{M}(k,l)\) and \(\alpha, eta\in R\), \[ egin{equation} abla_{c}\left(\alpha A^{a_{1}\cdots a_{k}}_{\quad\quad \ b_{1}\cdots b_{l}}+ eta B^{a_{1}\cdots a_{k}}_{\quad\quad \ b_{1}\cdots b_{l}} ight)=\alpha abla_{c}A^{a_{1}\cdots a_{k}}_{\quad\quad \ b_{1}\cdots b_{l}}+ eta B^{a_{1}\cdots a_{k}}_{\quad\quad \ b_{1}\cdots b_{l}} otag\end{equation}\]
  2. Leibnitz rule: For all \(A\in\mathscr{F}(k,l)\),\(B\in\mathscr{F}(k',l')\), \[ egin{align}& abla_{e}\left[A^{a_{1}\cdots a_{k}}_{\quad\quad\ b_{1}\cdots b_{k}} B^{c_{1}\cdots c_{k}}_{\quad\quad\ d_{1}\cdots d_{k}} ight] otag\&= abla_{e}\left[A^{a_{1}\cdots a_{k}}_{\quad\quad\ b_{1}\cdots b_{k}} ight] B^{c_{1}\cdots c_{k}}_{\quad\quad\ d_{1}\cdots d_{k}}+ abla_{e}A^{a_{1}\cdots a_{k}}_{\quad\quad\ b_{1}\cdots b_{k}} \left[B^{c_{1}\cdots c_{k}}_{\quad\quad\ d_{1}\cdots d_{k}} ight] otag\end{align}\]
  3. Commutativity with contraction: For all \(A\in\mathscr{F}(k,l), B\in\mathscr{F}(k',l'),\) \[ egin{equation} abla_{d}\left(A^{a_{1}\cdots c\cdots a_{k}}_{\quad\quad\quad\ \ b_{1}\cdots c\cdots b_{l}} ight)= abla_{d}A^{a_{1}\cdots c\cdots a_{k}}_{\quad\quad\quad\ \ b_{1}\cdots c\cdots b_{l}} otag\end{equation}\]
  4. Consistency with the notion of tangent vectors as directional derivatives on scalar fields: For all \(f\in\mathscr{F}\) and all \(t^{a}\in V_{p}\): \[ egin{equation}t(f)=t^{a} abla_{a}f otag\end{equation}\]
  5. Torsion free: For all \(f\in\mathscr{F}\), \[ egin{equation} abla_{a} abla_{b}f= abla_{b} abla_{a}f otag\end{equation}\]

When we write something like: \[ egin{equation} abla_{a}\left(v^{b}\omega_{b} ight)=v^{b} abla_{a}\omega_{b}+\omega_{b} abla_{a}v^{b}, otag\end{equation}\] we have actually used the third condition: \[ egin{equation} abla_{a}\left(v^{b}\omega_{c} ight)= abla_{a}\left[\mathrm{C}\left(v^{b}\omega_{c} ight) ight] =\mathrm{C}^{1}_{2}\left(v^{b} abla_{a}\omega_{c} ight)+\mathrm{C}^{1}_{2}\left[\left( abla_{a}v^{b} ight)\omega_{c} ight] =v^{b} abla_{a}\omega_{b}+\omega_{b} abla_{a}b^{b}, otag \end{equation}\]

where \(\mathrm{C}\) represents contraction.

From the forth condition, we can see that: \[ egin{equation} abla_{a}f=(\mathrm{d}f)_{a} ag{1.1}\label{1.1}\end{equation}\]

In fact, the operator satisfies this five conditions above must exist on any manifold. Now we consider the effects of two different derivative operators \( abla_{a}\) and \(\widetilde{ abla}_{a}\) on several kinds of tensors.

From Eq.\(\eqref{1.1}\), we know for all \(f\in \mathscr{F}_{M}\) \[ egin{equation} abla_{a} f=\widetilde{ abla}_{a} f=\left( \mathrm{d}f ight)_{a}. ag{1.2}\label{1.2}\end{equation}\]

Theorem 1.1\(\quad\) If \(p \in M\), \(\omega_{b}, \omega_{b}'\in \mathscr{F}(0,1)\) satisfy \(\omega_{b}'|_{p}=\omega_b|_{p}\), then \[ egin{equation}\left[\left(\widetilde{ abla}_{a}- abla_{a} ight)\omega_{b}' ight]_{p}=\left[\left(\widetilde{ abla}_{a}- abla_{a} ight)\omega_{b} ight]_{p} otag\end{equation}\] Proof\(\quad\) We only need to prove that \[ egin{equation}\left[ abla_{a}\left(\omega_{b}'-\omega_{b} ight) ight]_{p}=\left[\widetilde{ abla}_{a}\left(\omega_{b}'-\omega_{b} ight) ight]_{p}. ag{1.3}\label{1.3}\end{equation}\] Assume that \(\Omega=\omega_{b}'-\omega_{b}\). We can choose a coordinate system \(\left\{ x_{\mu} ight\}\) whose coordinate patch contains \(p\)，so \(\Omega_{\mu}(p)=0\) because \(\omega_{b}'|_{p}=\omega_{b}|_{p}\), where \(\Omega_{\mu}\)'s are the coordinates of \(\Omega_{b}\). For \(p\), \[ egin{align} \left[ abla_{a}\left(\omega_{b}'-\omega_{b} ight) ight]_{p}&=\left[ abla_{a}\Omega_{b} ight]_{p}=\left\{ abla_{a}\left[\Omega_{\mu}\left(\mathrm{d}x^{\mu} ight)_{b} ight] ight\}|_{p} otag\ &=\Omega_{\mu}(p)\left[ abla_{a}\left(\mathrm{d}x^{\mu} ight)_{b} ight]_{p}+\left[\left(\mathrm{d}x^{\mu} ight)_{b} abla_{a}\Omega_{\mu} ight]|_{p}=\left[\left(\mathrm{d}x^{\mu} ight)_{b} abla_{a}\Omega_{\mu} ight]_{p}. otag \end{align}\] In the same way, we have \(\left[\widetilde{ abla_{a}}\left(\omega_{b}'-\omega_{b} ight) ight]_{p}=\left[\left(\mathrm{d}x^{\mu} ight)_{b}\widetilde{ abla}_{a}\Omega_{\mu} ight]_{p}\). From Eq.\(\eqref{1.1}\), we know that \(\left[ abla_{a}\Omega_{\mu} ight]_{p}=\left[\widetilde{ abla}_{a}\Omega_{\mu} ight]_{p}=\left[(\mathrm{d}\Omega_{\mu})_{a} ight]_{p}\). So Eq.\(\eqref{1.3}\) is true.

Q.E.D.

Theorem 1.1 shows that \(\left[\left(\widetilde{ abla}_{a}- abla_{a} ight)\omega_{b} ight]_{p}\) depends only on \(\omega_{b}|_{p}\). And the value of \(\left(\widetilde{ abla}_{a}- abla_{a} ight)\) corresponds to a tenser of type \((1,2)\) \(\mathrm{C}^{c}_{\ \ ab}\), which satisfies \[\left[\left(\widetilde{ abla}_{a}- abla_{a} ight)\omega_{b} ight]_{p}=\mathrm{C}^{c}_{\ \ ab}\omega_{c}|_{p}.\] Since \(p\) is an arbitary point, so the effect of two derivative operators on \(\omega_{b}\) only differs by a tensor field of type \((1,2)\) on \(M\). To be specific,

Theorem 1.2 \(\quad\)For all \(\omega_{b}\in\mathscr{F}(0,1)\): \[ egin{align} abla_{a}\omega_{b}=\widetilde{ abla}_{a}\omega_{b}-\mathrm{C}^{a}_{\ \ ab}\omega_{c} ag{1.4}\label{1.4}\end{align}\]

Theorem 1.3\(\quad\) \(\mathrm{C}^{c}_{\ \ ab}=\mathrm{C}^{c}_{\ \ ba}\)

Proof\(\quad\) Let \(\omega_{b}= abla_{b}f=\widetilde{ abla}_{b}f\), where \(f\in\mathscr{F}_{M}\). From Eq.\(\eqref{1.4}\), we have \( abla_{a} abla_{b}f=\widetilde{ abla_{a}}\widetilde{ abla_{b}}f-\mathrm{C}^{c}_{\ \ ab} abla_{c}f\). Exchange the indicies \(a\) and \(b\) and we have \( abla_{b} abla_{a}f=\widetilde{ abla_{b}}\widetilde{ abla_{a}}f-\mathrm{C}^{c}_{\ \ ba} abla_{c}f\). Notice the last condition in the definition 1.1(torsion free), there is \(\mathrm{C}^{c}_{\ \ ab} abla_{c}f=\mathrm{C}^{c}_{\ \ ba} abla_{c}f\). Let \(T^{c}_{\ \ ab}=\mathrm{C}^{c}_{\ \ ab}-\mathrm{C}^{c}_{\ \ ba}\), then \(T^{c}_{\ \ ab} abla_{c}f=0\) for all \(f\in \mathscr{F}_{M}\). Then the coordinate components \(T^{\sigma}_{\ \ \mu u}=T^{c}_{\ \ ab}\left(\mathrm{d}x^{\sigma} ight)_{c}\left( rac{\partial}{\partial x^{\mu}} ight)^{a}\left( rac{\partial}{\partial x^{ u}} ight)^{b}=0\)(the second equality is because \(T^{c}_{\ \ ab}\left(\mathrm{d}x^{\sigma} ight)_{c}=T^{c}_{\ \ ab} abla_{c}x^{\sigma}=0\) ), so \(T^{c}_{\ \ ab}=0\).

Q.E.D

Theorem 1.4\(\quad\) For all \(v^{b}\in\mathscr{F(1,0)}\), \[ egin{align} abla_{a}v^{b}=\widetilde{ abla}_{a}v^{b}+\mathrm{C}^{b}_{\ \ ac}v^{c} otag \end{align}\]

Proof Let \(\omega_{b}\) be an arbitary dual vector field on manifold \(M\), then \[ egin{align} abla_{a}\left(\omega_{b} v^{b} ight)&=\omega_{b} abla_{a}v^{b}+v^{b} abla_{a}\omega_{b} otag\ &=\omega_{b} abla_{a}v^{b}+v^{b}\left(\widetilde{ abla}_{a}\omega_{b}-\mathrm{C}^{c}_{\ \ ab}\omega_{c} ight). ag{1.5}\label{1.5} \end{align}\] On the other hand, \(\widetilde{ abla}_{a}\left(\omega_{b}v^{b} ight)=\omega_{b}\widetilde{ abla}_{a}v^{b}+v^{b}\widetilde{ abla}_{a}\omega_{b}\). From Eq.\(\eqref{1.2}\), \( abla_{a}\left(\omega_{b}v^{b} ight)=\widetilde{ abla_{b}}\left(\omega_{b}v^{b} ight)\) because \(\omega_{b}v^{b}\) is a scaler field. Substitute this relation into Eq.\(\eqref{1.5}\), we have \[ egin{align} \omega_{b} abla_{a}v^{b}=\omega_{b}\widetilde{ abla}_{a}v^{b}+\mathrm{C}^{c}_{\ \ ab}v^{b}\omega_{c}=\omega_{b}\widetilde{ abla}_{a}v^{b}+\mathrm{C}^{b}_{\ \ ac}v^{c}\omega_{b} otag \end{align} \] for all \(\omega_{b}\in\mathscr{F}_{M}(0,1)\). So \( abla_{a}v^{b}=\widetilde{ abla}_{a}v^{b}+\mathrm{C}^{b}_{\ \ ac}v^{c}\).

Q.E.D

This theorem can be generalized.

Theorem 1.5\(\quad\) For all \(T\in\mathscr{F}_{M}(k,l)\) \[ egin{align} & abla_{a}T^{b_{1}\cdots b_{k}}_{\quad\quad\ \ c_{1}\cdots c_{l}} otag\ &=\widetilde{ abla}_{a}T^{b_{1}\cdots b_{k}}_{\quad\quad\ \ c_{1}\cdots c_{l}}+\sum_{i}\mathrm{C}^{b_{i}}_{\ \ \ ad}T^{b_{1}\cdots d\cdots b_{k}}_{\quad\quad\quad\ \ \ c_{1}\cdots c_{l}}-\sum_{j}C^{d}_{\ \ \ ac_{j}}T^{b_{1}\cdots b_{k}}_{\quad\quad\ \ c_{1}\cdots d\cdots c_{l}}. ag{1.6}\label{1.6} \end{align}\]

Any two derivative operators only differ by a tensor field \(\mathrm{C}^{c}_{\ \ ab}\). On the other hand, with any derivative operator \(\widetilde{ abla}_{a}\) and a tensor field \(\mathrm{C}^{c}_{\ \ ab}\) which is symmetric in down indicies (\(\mathrm{C}^{c}_{\ \ ab}=\mathrm{C}^{c}_{\ \ ba}\)), we can define a new operator according to Eq.\(\eqref{1.6}\) and this new operator will satisfy the definition of a derivative operator.

After choosing a derivative operator \( abla_{a}\), the manifold will be denoted by \((M, abla_{a})\).

Let \(\left\{x^{\mu} ight\}\) be a coordinate system on manifold \(M\). The mapping \(\partial_{a}: \mathscr{F}_{O}(k,l) ightarrow\mathscr{F}_{O}(k,l+1)\) is defined as: \[ egin{align} \partial_{a} T^{b}_{\ \ \ c}\equiv\left(\mathrm{d}x^{\mu} ight)_{a}\left( rac{\partial}{\partial x^{ u}} ight)^{b}\left(\mathrm{d}x^{\sigma} ight)_{c}\partial_{\mu}T^{ u}_{\ \ \ \sigma}. otag\end{align}\] It can be veryfied that \(\partial_{a}\) satisfies definition 1.1 and we call it ordinary derivative.

Althogh, \(\partial_{a}\) is a special case of \( abla_{a}\), it relies on the coordinate itself. We call the \( abla_{a}\)'s independent on the coordinate system covariant derivative and \(\partial_{a}\) is not a covariant derivative.

Definition 1.2\(\quad\)The difference between \( abla_{a}\) and \(\partial_{a}\) , i.e. \(\mathrm{C}^{c}_{\ \ ab}\) in Eq.\(\eqref{1.6}\),is called the Christoffel symbol of \( abla_{a}\) in this coordinate system which is denoted by \(\Gamma^{c}_{\ \ ab}\).

Christoffel symbol is a tensor field depends on the coordinate system.(See detailed discussion in《微分几何入门与广义相对论（上）第二版》p59).

Theorem 1.6\(\quad\) \[ egin{align}&v^{ u}_{\ \ ;\mu}=v^{ u}_{\ \ ,\mu}+\Gamma^{ u}_{\ \ \mu\sigma}v^{\sigma} ag{1.7}\label{1.7}\ &\omega_{ u\ \ ;\mu}=\omega_{ u\ \ ,\mu}-\Gamma^{\sigma}_{\ \ \mu u}\omega_{\sigma} otag \end{align}\]

Derivative And Parallel Transport Of Vector Field Along Curve

Parallel Transport Of Vector Field Along Curve

After choosing a derivative operator on manifold \(M\), we have the definition of parallel transport Of vector field along a curve.

Definition 2.1 \(\quad\) Let \(v^{a}\) be a vector field defined on a curve \(C(t)\). \(v^{a}\) is said to be transported parallelly along \(C(t)\) if \(T^{b} abla_{b}v^{a}=0\) is satisfied along the curve where \(T^{a}\equiv\left( rac{\partial}{\partial t} ight)^{a}\) is the tangent vector of \(C(t)\).

Theorem 2.1\(\quad\) Let the equation of the curve \(C(t)\) be \(x^{\mu}(t)\) and \(T^{a}=\left( rac{\partial}{\partial t} ight)^{a}\) , then the vector field \(v^{a}\) transports parallelly along \(C(t)\) satisfies: \[ egin{align} T^{b} abla_{b}v^{a}=\left( rac{\partial}{\partial x^{\mu}} ight)^{a}\left( rac{\mathrm{d}v^{\mu}}{\mathrm{d} t}+\Gamma^{\mu}_{\ \ u\sigma}T^{ u}v^{\sigma} ight) ag{2.1}\label{2.1} \end{align}\] Proof \[ egin{align} T^{b} abla_{b}v^{a}&=T^{b}\left(\partial_{b}v^{a}+\Gamma^{a}_{\ \ bc}v^{c} ight) otag\ &=T^{b}\left[\left(\mathrm{d}x^{ u}_{b} ight)\left( rac{\partial}{\partial x^{\mu}} ight)^{a}\partial_{ u}v^{\mu}+\Gamma^{a}_{\ \ bc}v^{c} ight] otag\ &=T^{ u}\left( rac{\partial}{\partial x^{ u}} ight)^{a}\left( rac{\partial v^{\mu}}{\partial x^{ u}} ight)+\Gamma^{a}_{\ \ bc}T^{b}v^{c} otag\ &=\left( rac{\partial}{\partial x^{\mu}} ight)^{a}\left[T^{\mu}\left( rac{\partial v^{\mu}}{\partial x^{ u}} ight)+\Gamma^{\mu}_{\ \ u\sigma}T^{ u}v^{\sigma} ight]. otag \end{align}\] Notice that \(T^{ u}= rac{\mathrm{d}x^{ u}(t)}{\mathrm{d}t}\), we have \[ egin{align} T^{ u}\left( rac{\partial v^{\mu}}{\partial x^{ u}} ight)&=\left[ rac{\mathrm{d}x^{ u}(t)}{\mathrm{d}t} ight]\left[ rac{\partial v^{\mu}\left(t(x) ight)}{\partial x^{ u}} ight] otag\ &= rac{\mathrm{d}v^{ u}(t)}{\mathrm{d}t} otag \end{align}\] Q.E.D

Theorem 2.2\(\quad\) A point on the curve \(C(t)\) together with a vector at the point determine the only vector field transports parallelly along the curve. Proof\(\quad\)From Eq.\(\eqref{2.1}\) , we know: \[ egin{align} rac{\mathrm{d}v^{\mu}}{\mathrm{d}t}+\Gamma^{\mu}_{\ \ u\sigma}T^{ u}v^{\sigma}=0,\quad \mu=1,2\cdots n. \end{align}\] These are \(n\) ODEs of first order and there are enough initial conditions to determine the solution.

Q.E.D

Let \(p,q\in M\), then \(V_{p}\) and \(V{q}\) are two different vector space and any two elements from them can't be compared directly. Given a vector in \(p\) (or \(q\)),we can choose a curve passes \(p\) and \(q\). Using Theorem 2.2, there is only one vector field determine by the curve and the vector. So we can compare the value of the vector field at \(p\) (or \(q\)) with the given vector in \(q\) (or \(p\)). The vector field depend on the choice of the curve. Anyway, \( abla_{a}\) connects these two vector, so we call \( abla_{a}\) connection.

Derivative Curvatur Compatible With The Metric

entry.title: TikZ导出PNG格式图片
entry.content:
利用LaTeX的TikZ宏包可以绘制图形，但是默认导出的为pdf格式。有时我们需要PNG等图片格式以便于插入在网页上，于是需要将pdf格式转换为图片格式。 # 安装ImageMagick

首先，我们去ImageMagick官网下载合适版本的ImageMagick。下载完成后安装即可。安装完成后将安装目录添加到系统Path路径中(系统搜索环境变量)。

允许-shell-escape

不同编辑器允许-shell-escape的方式不同，可以在这个StackExchange问题下查找：How can I enable shell-escape?。

此处以VScode中的LaTeX Workshop插件为例。 打开VScode，确保已经安装LaTex Workshop。按下Ctrl+Shift+P，输入Preferences: Open Settings (JSON)。进入settings.json中添加如下代码 

"latex-workshop.latex.tools": [
    {
        "name": "latexmk",
        "command": "latexmk",
        "args": [
            "-shell-escape",  
            "-synctex=1",
            "-interaction=nonstopmode",
            "-file-line-error",
            "-pdf",
            "-outdir=%OUTDIR%",
            "%DOC%"
        ],
        "env": {}
    },
    ...
]
如果以前输入过，只需在"args"栏目中添加"-shell-escape"一项。这样就允许了-shell-excape。

LaTeX代码设置

为了导出PNG格式，我们选用standalone文档类，调用其中的convert选项来完成格式转换。下面给出一个例子： 

\documentclass[convert={convertexe={magick}}]{standalone}
\usepackage{tikz-cd}
\usepackage{amsmath,amssymb}
\usepackage{mathtools}
\pagecolor{white}
\begin{document}
\begin{tikzcd}[row sep=huge]
    &D^{2}\arrow[dl,shift right]\arrow[dr,shift left,"+S^{1}"]{+S^{1}}&\\
    \mathbb{R}^{2}\arrow[ur,shift right]\arrow[rr,"+\{\infty\}"] &         &S^{2}\arrow[ul,shift left,"-\{p\}"]
\end{tikzcd}
$\xRightarrow{\text{generlization}} S^{n}=\mathbb{R}^{n}\bigcup \{\infty\}$
\end{document}
注意以下几点： 1. 代码第一行的文档选项convert={convertexe={magick}}里面的magick为下载的ImageMagick中.exe文件的文件名（以后版本文件名也可能有变化，要注意改变）。网上其他相关的资料可能文档选项只有convert，因为ImageMagick早期版本可能文件名与现在不同。 2. 转换后得到的PNG图片可能背景是透明的,\pagecolor{white}可以让背景变为白色。 3. 默认得到的为300dpi的PNG格式图片。可以更改选项调整得到需要的图片，具体见：standalone官方文档。

entry.title: Topological Space
entry.content:
Basics of Sets

This part is relatively simple, so I will only list the definitions and properties instead of elaborating it.

In mathematics, a set is a collection of elements. Every item in a set is called an element or point. If \(x\) is an element of \(X\), then \(x\) belongs to \(X\), and we denote it as \(x\in X\). \(\notin\) means "not belong to". A set doesn't contain any element is called an empty set, which is denoted by \(\emptyset\). >Definition 1: If every element in a set \(A\) belongs to the set \(X\), then \(A\) is a subset of \(X\), which is denoted by \(A\subset X\) or \(X\supset A\). \(\emptyset\) is a subset of any set. \(A\) is called a proper subset of \(X\) if \(A\subset X\) and \(A\neq X\). \(A=B\) if \(X\subset Y\) and \(Y\subset X\).

entry.title: 让博客支持mathjax渲染公式
entry.content:
从起床折腾到晚上，累趴。。。

总体思路是卸载掉hexo默认的hexo-renderer-marked，改用hexo-renderer-pandoc。（就是这么简单的一步。。。）

首先如果没安装pandoc的话，去官网下载。安装完重启电脑。

然后命令行里进入博客的路径(.../blog)，利用npm uninstall hexo-renderer-marked --registry=https://registry.npm.taobao.org卸载掉原来的hexo-renderer-marked。执行npm install hexo-renderer-pandoc --registry=https://registry.npm.taobao.org安装上hexo-renderer-pandoc。

打开theme的_config.yml，修改里面的mathjax的false为true。

在blog目录下的_config.yml加上下面的代码： 

math:
  engine: 'mathjax' # or 'katex'
  mathjax:
    # src: custom_mathjax_source
    config:
      # MathJax config
保存并退出。接下来执行hexo clean，hexo g，hexo s即可看到公式被渲染。
